titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1823 Oct. 24 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1823 Oct. 24
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Friday October 24, 1823 session of court, in which two cases were heard. Circuit court judge John Martin signed the docket on this day. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 10 Oclock Friday 24th.
div.p:
Court convened agreeable to adjournment. Present honors John Martin, James Daniel, Richard Walker, Circuit judges. Jurors
Georges George Saunders, Foreman.

Joseph Crutchfield, compromised a judgement, obtained, by Robert Vann against said Joseph Crutchfield for $922, Witness my hand & seal this 24 of October 1823 which this is a copy of their proceeding. J Martin CSC Cherokee Supreme Court

Harry Vicory
Cpt Captain
vs
George Lee
Dft Defendant

a plea of debt This day came the plaintiff and thereupon a jury (to wit) George Saunders, Foreman, upon their oaths do say that the said Harry Vicory shall recover from the sd. said George Lee, thirty dollars, for a Gun, for which the light horse, took from said Vicory, Given from under my hand at New Town this 24th day of October 1823

closer.add: Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock
